attributes.action: Reduce the cost of vets’ fees, especially for out -of-hours services.
attributes.additional_details:
I want the Government to know that vets’ fees cannot be paid with a ‘working-wage’ and many animals are donated to, euthanised or left as unwanted by so many charitable rescue centres.  

We want to keep our pets. 
We don’t want our pets to suffer.
We want reasonably priced fees for every day of the week!
attributes.background:
I want the Government to help reduce the cost of vets’ fees, especially with the out-of-hours provision. 
I want the Government to recognise that there hundreds of pets given to rescue centres, due to the cost of vets’ fees.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for vet fees. This is a matter for individual veterinary practices.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Create a “PHS (Pet Health Service)” Scheme paid for by pet owners: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564754

Create a free Animal Health Service for pets please: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581142
